page.title: 02Hollywood Farm
page.content: This Victorian farm is situated near Tendring.It has been owned by this family since 1934.The farmer has two sons that help him.It is a small arable farm with approximately 450 acres-used for wheat, barley sugarbeet and peas.The soil is of pH 7.5, ideal for these crops.The peas are used to feed racing pigeons.The wheat is used for making cattle food and bread.The grain is used for malting.The sugarbeet goes to a factory in Ipswich to make sugar. They have 4 tractors,and a big combine harvester. The farm has 9 storage bins for the grain.Membership of the EEC has increased his income, and can therefore invest in modern machinery. He no longer will burn the stubble, due to new local Bye-laws.He has a shredder on the back of his combine harvester.
